data.title: In-Game Map Editor
data.body:
Instead of the buggy WinForms (which is even depreceated on Windows) based map editor (that does not work on Mac #2939, #2295 etc.) we could consequently redo it in-game with OpenRA widgets. This way we could use the existing renderer to avoid code duplication and glitchy quick hacks as well as get Voxel support for free. Depends on
- [x] Ability to save maps
- [x] Adding actors
- [x] Change the terrain tiles
- [x] Place resource patches

This might even get us co-op mapping if done right.

WIP at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496

data.title: Pathingdomains
data.body:
OpenRA island maps are essentially unplayable with the regular AI because the pathfinder always searches out from both the origin and the destination.  If it is trying to route between two different landmasses or bodies of water, this results in a lot of needless searching and consequently intense pathfinding spikes.

I chose the simplest working solution to this that I could think of: this patch assigns a unique integer "domain" to each contiguous mass of land or water, and if a pathfinding request crosses domains, it is invalid and need not be serviced.

data.title: Rework aircraft destruction to use husks instead of the original actor
data.body: This replaces dead aircraft with aircraft husks. The new aircraft husk runs the FallToEarth activity instead and the original aircraft is removed. This probably fixes the zombie aircraft bug and it fixes #3324. It causes the aircraft to flicker slightly when it's being swapped out but this is not a new problem

data.title: Tiberian Sun / Red Alert 2 mod
data.body:
This is a tracking bug for the engine changes that are required to support Tiberian Sun and Red Alert 2 on the OpenRA engine.  The main goal of these efforts will be shipping our WIP TS mod in the main OpenRA download.

The main requirements are:
- [x] Voxels. [#3274]
- [x] Orthographic tileset support. [#5350]
- [x] MixFile package format changes [#3227]
- [x] SHP sprite format changes. [#3193, #4185]
- [x] Sequence changes ordered sprites. [#3333, #3571]
- [x] VQA video file format changes. [#3226]
- [x] Heightmap support for shroud [#8781]

data.title: Added Survival02
data.body: Second Single-player Survival Mission.

data.title: TS/RA2 Voxel support
data.body:
This adds everything necessary to parse vxl/hva assets, render them ingame, and traits suitable to wire up most of the TS/RA2 units. I finally have this in a state that i'm mostly happy with, so it's time to get some external feedback.

See my [voxeldemo](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/voxeldemo) branch for a testcase which replaces C&C units with TS equivalents. It expects TIBSUN.MIX and ts_conquer.mix (extract and rename CONQUER.MIX to avoid a naming conflict) to exist in ^/Content/ts/

data.title: Add Tournament Island map to RA
data.body: This is a map that I made, based on a map of the same name from Generals. It encourages securing and defending the oil derricks at the centre, defending the oil derricks at your base, and using amphibious warfare to destroy your opponent's oil derricks and base. This map does not have any custom rules. It's also a pretty awesome candidate for a KOTH map.

data.title: Fix BinaryReader / stream inconsistencies.
data.body:
BinaryReader internally buffers bytes, meaning that the underlying stream position may not reflect the assumed position.

This adds extension methods for directly reading basic types from a Stream, and removes BinaryReader from the format parsers that incorrectly used BinaryReader.BaseStream.

The R8Reader changes will need to be tested by someone with access to the appropriate assets before merging.

data.title: fixes d2k mod Sound weapon
data.body: I hadn't noticed that the D2K mod's Sound weapon uses LaserZap as well. Added HitAnim and replaced BeamRadius with BeamWidth.

data.title: connecting to a server -> crash to desktop

data.title: connecting to a server -> crash to desktop
Renderer refactoring - Traits
data.body:
This should be the last of the major refactoring patches preparing for voxel units.
The RenderSimple trait is split into three (RenderSimple, RenderSprites, BodyOrientation) to support sprite additions (smoke, muzzleflash, etc) on voxel units, and voxel addons on sprite units (titan barrel).

The turret behavior and sequence definitions have been modified to support the giant walking edge-case that is the Titan (legs with 8 facings, turret with 32 facings, voxel barrel, clockwise sprite orientation).

There isn't much custom behavior left in RenderSimple/RenderUnit/RenderBuilding. A future patch should look into unifying these (WithBody:?) and clean up the mess of code relating to RenderSprites.anims.
